article_title: James River Coal Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
article_text:
Appalachian coal miner James River Coal Co. filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection Monday as it continues its search for a buyer or investor.

The Wall Street Journal in February reported that the Richmond, Va., company hired advisers to help it explore a sale and other strategic alternatives, an effort the company will continue in Chapter 11.

"We took this action to restructure under Chapter 11 because it will allow us...
